name: Teemu Roos
content: Teemu Roos Teemu Roos Professor of Computer Science Coleader of the Complex Systems Computation (CoSCo) research group Leader of the AI Education program in the Finnish Center for AI Department of Computer Science and Helsinki Institute for Information Technology HIIT Exactum building, A322 PO Box 68 FI-00014 University of Helsinki Finland photo: Maarit KytÃ¶harju contact: teemu.roos@helsinki.fi CV (pdf) troos teemu-roos My Profile on the University Research Portal (projects, awards, publications) What's up? Sen sijaan perusteiden avulla saavutetaan kyky osallistua tekoÃ¤lyyn liittyvÃ¤Ã¤n yhteiskunnalliseen keskusteluun ja arvioida kriittisesti esitettyjÃ¤ vÃ¤itteitÃ¤ â€“ "tekoÃ¤lyn lukutaito". (Teemu Roos) The aim is not to train the entire population as AI developers. Instead, knowing the basics enables one to engage in the public discourse on AI and to critically evaluate arguments about it â€“ "AI literacy". (Teemu Roos) Selected conference and workshop involvement (program committee or equivalent): AISTATS-2011/2014/2015/2022 ICML-2018/2019/2020/2021/2022/2024 IJCAI-2013/2015/2018 NeurIPS-2014/2015/2016/2017/2018/2019/2020/2021/2022/2023/2024/2025 UAI-2008/2009/2010/2011/2012/2013/2014/2015/2016/2017/2018/2019/2020/2021/2022/2023/2024/2025. Assoc. for Maths and Natural Sciences (MAL) MSc Thesis Award Arttu Modig (MSc 2014), co-supervised with Prof Jouko Lampinen (Aalto) Janne LeppÃ¤-aho (MSc 2014), co-supervised with Prof Jukka Corander Henning LÃ¼bbers (MSc 2012), co-supervised with Prof Jyrki Kivinen Anupam Arohi (MSc 2011) Yuan Zou (MSc 2011) Teemu Pulkkinen (MSc 2011) Toni Merivuori (MSc 2009) Lari Latvala (MSc 2009), co-supervised with Prof Jouko Laasasenaho Students interested in MSc/PhD thesis topics related to information theory, statistical modeling, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and digital humanities are welcome to contact me by e-mail (but see disclaimer below). Disclaimer: If you currently not enrolled at the University of Helsinki, please do not send me e-mail, but contact the Department of Computer Science for information about the application process. Unfortunately I cannot reply to all e-mail inquiries. Research I am a coleader of the Complex Systems Computation (CoSCo) research group together with Petri MyllymÃ¤ki. I'm also affiliated with the Finnish Center for AI (FCAI). Past Events I have held visiting positions at CWI Amsterdam (2003 & 2005), UC Berkeley (2008, 2015), MIT (2010), University of Cambridge (2012), and the Finnish Institute in Rome (2013). Afrabandpey in 2017â€“2018. Janne LeppÃ¤-aho received the best student paper honorable mention at PGM-2018 with the paper 'Learning non-parametric Markov networks with mutual information'. Our joint proposal with M-Brain was accepted by Business Finland and we joined the NSF Industryâ€“University Cooperative Research Center on Visual & Decision Informatics in 2018. My traveling/conference schedule in 2018: ITA-2018, San Diego, February 11â€“16 UCSD, February 1â€“21 UC Berkeley, February 26â€“March 22 Apple, Cupertino, March 21 Targeted Discovery in Brain Data Workshop, Simons Institute, Berkeley, March 19â€“22 Princeton, March 23 CMU, Pittsburgh, March 26â€“30 Google AI, Pittsburgh, March 26 ALT 2018, Lanzarote, April 7â€“9 AISTATS 2018, Lanzarote, April 9â€“11 WiFiUS Meeting and Summer School, Boston, June 11â€“16 UCSC Milano, Milan, October 24â€“November 14 6/2017: The Academy of Finland has awarded two new grants to our research group. TensorML project (4 years) will study non-standard machine learning problems with applications in drug design, and MachQu project (2 years) will apply probabilistic machine learning to quantum-mechanics based material design. 4/2017: Our joint proposal with Prof. Pulkit Grover (CMU) on ''Efficient and Robust Cognitive IoT Systems using Unreliable Sensors'' is funded by the Academy of Finland and NSF.
